intro: Ptilotus corymbosus var. acutifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spinifex, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its dense, cylindrical clusters of small, spike-like leaves. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology and resilience make it an important component of native ecosystems.
